page.title: 01Bramhope: Introduction
page.content: Originally an agricultural community of 260 people in 1801,Bramhope has expanded into a compact dormitory settlement,with a population of 3395 in 1971.Following the construction of the{Leeds-Otley turnpike road {(1840-42)}and{Bramhope Railway Tunnel {(1846-49)},Leeds Businessmen began to make their homes in Bramhope.This pattern has continued.While the D-Block has an agricultural base,the working population largely commutes out of the area.Rural in character, protected by{Green Belt}with excellent regional transport links and wide ranging social activities,Bramhope is an attractive place to live.The accent of recent development has been on presteige detached properties currently commanding Â£60-100 000, catering for an executive/professional market.
